intro: Platygyna triandra, commonly known as the African velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to sub-Saharan Africa. It is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. It is often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and agricultural fields. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its widespread distribution across the region.
